CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Administrative proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was a civil servant until he took early retirement on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to ORG of ORG ( “ the Regional Division ” ) for an enhanced pension . He claimed that his illness had been caused by his work .

CARDINAL . On DATE the file was forwarded to ORG for preparation of the case . Following the entry into force of Legislative Decree no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , which abolished the role of ORG in pensions litigation , the file was sent back to ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . The first hearing was held on DATE . By an order of the same date , which was deposited with the registry on DATE , ORG requested the opinion of ORG . On DATE the applicant was examined by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG set down a hearing for DATE .
